original: 2. Dukkarakārikapañha🔽“Bhante nāgasena, sabbeva bodhisattā dukkarakārikaṁ karonti, udāhu gotameneva bodhisattena dukkarakārikā katā”ti?
analyzed: dukkara kārika pañha  bhante nāgasena sabbe iva bodhisattāḥ dukkara kārikam karonti udāhu gotamena iva bodhisattena dukkara kārikā katā ati
translated: The Chapter on the Performance of Difficult Tasks🔽“Is it the case, revered sir, that all Bodhisattas perform the performance of difficult tasks, or was the performance of difficult tasks performed only by the Bodisat Gotama?”

original: “Natthi, mahārāja, sabbesaṁ bodhisattānaṁ dukkarakārikā, gotameneva bodhisattena dukkarakārikā katā”ti.
analyzed: natthi mahā rāja sabbesam bodhisattānam dukkara kārikā gotamena iva bodhisattena dukkara kārikā katā ati
translated: “There is no performance of difficult tasks, sire, for all Bodhisattas; the performance of difficult tasks was performed only by the Bodisat Gotama.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, yadi evaṁ ayuttaṁ, yaṁ bodhisattānaṁ bodhisattehi vemattatā hotī”ti.
analyzed: bhante nāgasena yadi evam yam bodhisattānam bodhisattehi vematta tā hoti iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, if that is so, then it is not right that there should be a difference among the Bodhisattas.”

original: “Catūhi, mahārāja, ṭhānehi bodhisattānaṁ bodhisattehi vemattatā hoti.
analyzed: catūhi mahā rāja ṭhānehi bodhisattānam bodhisattehi vematta tā hoti
translated: “There are four grounds, sire, on which there is a difference among the Bodhisattas.

original: Katamehi catūhi?
analyzed: katamehi catūhi
translated: What are the four?

original: Kulavemattatā padhānavemattatā āyuvemattatā pamāṇavemattatāti.
analyzed: kula vematta tā padhāna vematta tā āyu vematta tā pamāṇa vematta tā ati
translated: Difference of family, difference of striving, difference of life-span, difference of size.

original: Imehi kho, mahārāja, catūhi ṭhānehi bodhisattānaṁ bodhisattehi vemattatā hoti.
analyzed: imehi kho mahā rāja catūhi ṭhānehi bodhisattānam bodhisattehi vematta tā hoti
translated: On these four grounds, sire, there is a difference among the Bodhisattas.

original: Sabbesampi, mahārāja, buddhānaṁ rūpe sīle samādhimhi paññāya vimuttiyā vimuttiñāṇadassane
analyzed: sabbesam pi mahā rāja buddhānam rūpe sīle samādhimhi paññāya vimuttiyāḥ vimutti ñāṇa dassane
translated: But in all the Buddhas, sire, there is no difference in their form, in their virtue, in their mental concentration, in their wisdom, in their deliverance, in their knowledge and insight of deliverance,

original: catuvesārajje dasatathāgatabale chaasādhāraṇañāṇe cuddasabuddhañāṇe aṭṭhārasabuddhadhamme
analyzed: catu vesārajje dasa tathāgata bale cha a sādhāraṇa ñāṇe cuddasa buddha ñāṇe aṭṭhārasa buddha dhamme
translated: in the four grounds of self-confidence, in the ten powers of a Tathāgata, in the six kinds of knowledge not held in common (with disciples), in the fourteen knowledges of a Buddha, in the eighteen special attributes of a Buddha,

original: kevale ca buddhaguṇe natthi vemattatā, sabbepi buddhā buddhadhammehi samasamā”ti.
analyzed: kevale ca buddha guṇe natthi vematta tā sabbe pi buddhāḥ buddha dhammehi samasamā ati
translated: in the unique qualities of a Buddha, there is no difference. All Buddhas are equal in the attributes of a Buddha.”

original: “Yadi, bhante nāgasena, sabbepi buddhā buddhadhammehi samasamā, kena kāraṇena gotameneva bodhisattena dukkarakārikā katā”ti?
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena sabbe api buddhāḥ buddha dhammehi samasamā kena kāraṇena gotamena iva bodhisattena dukkara kārikā katā ati
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, if all Buddhas are equal in the attributes of a Buddha, why was the difficult task performed only by the Bodhisatta Gotama?”

original: “Aparipakke, mahārāja, ñāṇe aparipakkāya bodhiyā gotamo bodhisatto nekkhammamabhinikkhanto aparipakkaṁ ñāṇaṁ paripācayamānena dukkarakārikā katā”ti.
analyzed: aparipakke mahā rāja ñāṇe aparipakkāya bodhiyā gotamaḥ bodhisatto nekkhammam abhinikkhantaḥ aparipakkam ñāṇam paripācayamānena dukkara kārikā katā ati
translated: “Great king, when the Bodhisatta Gotama went forth from home into homelessness his knowledge was not yet ripe, his enlightenment was not yet ripe. He went forth in order to ripen his knowledge. He performed the difficult tasks in order to ripen his unripe knowledge.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, kena kāraṇena bodhisatto aparipakke ñāṇe aparipakkāya bodhiyā mahābhinikkhamanaṁ nikkhanto, nanu nāma ñāṇaṁ paripācetvā paripakke ñāṇe nikkhamitabban”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena kena kāraṇena bodhisattaḥ aparipakke ñāṇe aparipakkāya bodhiyā mahā abhinikkhamanam nikkhantaḥ nanu nāma ñāṇam paripācetvā paripakke ñāṇe nikkhamitabbanti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, why did the Bodhisatta go forth from home into homelessness when his knowledge was not yet ripe and his enlightenment was not yet ripe? Should he not have gone forth when his knowledge was ripe and his enlightenment was ripe?”

original: “Bodhisatto, mahārāja, viparītaṁ itthāgāraṁ disvā vippaṭisārī ahosi, tassa vippaṭisārissa🔽arati uppajji, araticittaṁ uppannaṁ disvā aññataro mārakāyiko devaputto ‘ayaṁ kho
analyzed: bodhisattaḥ mahā rāja viparītam itthā āgāram disvā vippaṭisārī ahosi tassa vippaṭisārissa  arati uppajji arati cittam uppannam disvā aññataraḥ māra kāyikaḥ deva putto ayam kho
translated: Because of his confusion

original: kālo araticittassa vinodanāyā’ti vehāse ṭhatvā idaṁ vacanamabravi—
analyzed: kālaḥ arati cittassa vinodanāya ati vehāse idam vacanam abravi
translated: discontent arose in him. Seeing that his mind was discontented, a certain god of Māra’s retinue, thinking: ‘This is the time to dispel his discontent,’ stood in the air and spoke this verse:

original: ‘Mārisa, mā kho tvaṁ ukkaṇṭhito ahosi, ito te sattame divase dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ🔽pātubhavissati sahassāraṁ sanemikaṁ sanābhikaṁ sabbākāraparipūraṁ, pathavigatāni🔽ca te ratanāni ākāsaṭṭhāni ca sayameva upagacchissanti, dvisahassaparittadīpaparivāresu
analyzed: mārisa mā kho tvam ukkaṇṭhitaḥ ahosi itas te sattame divase dibbam cakkaratana  pātubhavissati sahassāram sa nemikam sa nābhikam sabba ākāraparipūra pathavigatāni  ca te ratanāni ākāsaṭṭhāni ca sayam eva upagacchissanti dvi sahassa paritta dīpa parivāresu
translated: ‘Do not be discontented, good sir, for on the seventh day from now🔽the divine Wheel-Treasure will appear to you, with a thousand spokes, complete with all appurtenances, and will come to you from the east. And the treasures of the earth🔽and those in the sky will of their own accord come to you. You will rule over the four great continents, surrounded by a retinue of two thousand kings,

original: catūsu mahādīpesu ekamukhena āṇā pavattissati, parosahassañca te puttā bhavissanti
analyzed: catūsu mahā dīpesu eka mukhena āṇā pavattissati parosahassam ca te puttāḥ bhavissanti
translated: and you will have more than a thousand sons,

original: sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā, tehi puttehi parikiṇṇo sattaratanasamannāgato
analyzed: sūrā vīraṅga rūpā para sena pamaddanā tehi puttehi parikiṇṇaḥ satta ratana samannāgato
translated: valiant, heroic, crushing the armies of the foe. Surrounded by your sons, endowed with the seven treasures,

original: catuddīpamanusāsissasī’ti.
analyzed: catur dīpam anusāsissasi iti
translated: you will rule over the people of the four great continents.’

original: Yathā nāma divasasantattaṁ ayosūlaṁ sabbattha upaḍahantaṁ kaṇṇasotaṁ paviseyya;
analyzed: yathā nāma divasa santattam ayaḥ sūlam sabbattha upaḍahantam kaṇṇa sotam paviseyya
translated: Just as if a red-hot iron ball were thrust into the ear,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, bodhisattassa taṁ vacanaṁ kaṇṇasotaṁ pavisittha, iti so pakatiyāva ukkaṇṭhito tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyoso mattāya ubbijji saṁvijji saṁvegamāpajji.🔽Yathā pana, mahārāja, mahatimahāaggikkhandho jalamāno aññena kaṭṭhena upaḍahito bhiyyoso mattāya jaleyya;
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bodhisattassa tam vacanam kaṇṇa sotam pavisittha iti saḥ pakati yāva ukkaṇṭhitaḥ tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyosaḥ mattāya ubbijji sa vijji sa vegam āpajji  yathā pana mahā rāja mahati mahā aggi khandhaḥ jalamānaḥ aññena kaṭṭhena upaḍahitaḥ bhiyyosas mattāya jaleyya
translated: so did the Bodhisatta’s words enter his ear. And so, already discontented, he became even more discontented, and was agitated and distressed.

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, bodhisatto pakatiyāva ukkaṇṭhito tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyoso mattāya ubbijji saṁvijji saṁvegamāpajji.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bodhisatto pakati yāva ukkaṇṭhitaḥ tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyosaḥ mattāya ubbijji sa vijji sa vegam āpajji
translated: Just as if a great mass of fire were burning, and another log were added to it, so would the Bodhisatta’s words enter his ear. And so, already discontented, he became even more discontented, and was agitated and distressed.

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, mahāpathavī pakatitintā nibbattaharitasaddalā āsittodakā cikkhallajātā punadeva mahāmeghe abhivuṭṭhe bhiyyoso mattāya cikkhallatarā assa;
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja mahā pathavī pakati tintā nibbatta harita saddalā āsitta udakā cikkhalla jātā punadeva mahā meghe abhivuṭṭhe bhiyyosas mattāya cikkhallatarā assa
translated: Just as if the great earth were covered with water, and green grass grew on it, and then a great rain fell, so that the grass was covered with water,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, bodhisatto pakatiyāva ukkaṇṭhito tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyoso mattāya ubbijji saṁvijji saṁvegamāpajjī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bodhisatto pakati yāva ukkaṇṭhitaḥ tassā devatāya vacanena bhiyyosaḥ mattāya ubbijji sa vijji sa vegam āpajji iti
translated: Even so, sire, the Bodhisatta, who was naturally disgusted, was still more disgusted, distressed and grieved by the words of that deity.”

original: “Api nu kho, bhante nāgasena, bodhisattassa yadi sattame divase dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ nibbatteyya, paṭinivatteyya bodhisatto dibbe cakkaratane nibbatte”ti?
analyzed: api nu kho bhante nāgasena bodhisattassa yadi sattame divase dibbam cakka ratanam nibbatteyya paṭinivatteyya bodhisattaḥ dibbe cakka ratane nibbattā iti
translated: “But, revered sir, if the divine Wheel-Treasure had appeared to the Bodhisatta on the seventh day, would the Bodhisatta have turned back from his quest?”

original: “Na hi, mahārāja, sattame divase bodhisattassa dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ nibbatteyya, api🔽ca palobhanatthāya tāya devatāya musā bhaṇitaṁ, yadipi, mahārāja, sattame divase
analyzed: na hi mahā rāja sattame divase bodhisattassa dibbam cakka ratanam api  ca palobhana tthāya tāya devatāya musā bhaṇita yadi pi mahā rāja sattame divase
translated: “No, sire, the divine Wheel-Treasure would not have appeared to the Bodhisatta on the seventh day.

original: dibbaṁ cakkaratanaṁ nibbatteyya, bodhisatto na nivatteyya.
analyzed: dibbam cakka ratanam nibbatteyya bodhisattaḥ na nivatteyya
translated: But, sire, the deity spoke falsely in order to tempt him. Even if, sire, the divine Wheel-Treasure had appeared to the Bodhisatta on the seventh day, the Bodhisatta would not have turned back.

original: Kiṅkāraṇaṁ?
analyzed: kiṅkāraṇa
translated: And why not?

original: ‘Aniccan’ti, mahārāja, bodhisatto daḷhaṁ aggahesi, ‘dukkhaṁ anattā’ti daḷhaṁ aggahesi, upādānakkhayaṁ patto.
analyzed: aniccanti mahā rāja bodhisatto daḷham aggahesi dukkham anattā ati daḷham aggahesi upādāna kkhayam patto
translated: Because, sire, the Bodhisatta had firmly grasped the impermanence of all conditioned things, the suffering inherent in all that is conditioned, the changelessness of Nibbana.”

original: Yathā, mahārāja, anotattadahato udakaṁ gaṅgaṁ nadiṁ pavisati, gaṅgāya nadiyā mahāsamuddaṁ
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja udakam gaṅgam nadim pavisati gaṅgāya nadiyāḥ mahā samudda

analyzed: pavisati mahā samuddato pātāla mukham pavisati api nu mahā rāja tam udakam pātāla mukha gata
translated: and from the great ocean it enters the mouth of the nether world, now, sire, would that water, having gone to the mouth of the nether world,

analyzed: paṭinivattitvā mahā samuddam paviseyya mahā samuddataḥ gaṅgam nadim paviseyya gaṅgāya
translated: return and enter the great ocean, and from the great ocean enter the Ganges river, and from the Ganges river

translated: enter the Anotatta lake again?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti
translated: “No, revered sir.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, bodhisattena kappānaṁ satasahassaṁ caturo ca asaṅkhyeyye
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja bodhisattena kappānam sata sahassam caturaḥ ca asaṅkhyeyye
translated: “Even so, sire, for a hundred thousand aeons and for four incalculables the Bodhisatta

original: kusalaṁ paripācitaṁ imassa bhavassa kāraṇā, soyaṁ antimabhavo anuppatto paripakkaṁ🔽bodhiñāṇaṁ chahi vassehi buddho bhavissati sabbaññū loke aggapuggalo, api nu kho,
analyzed: kusalam paripācitam imassa bhavassa kāraṇā saḥ ayam antima bhavaḥ an uppattaḥ paripakka  bodhiñāṇam chahi vassehi buddhaḥ bhavissati sabbaññū loke agga puggalaḥ api nu kho
translated: has developed merit for the sake of this existence, and now that he has come to his last existence, his knowledge of enlightenment

original: mahārāja, bodhisatto cakkaratanakāraṇā paṭinivatteyyā”ti?
analyzed: mahā rāja bodhisatto cakka ratana kāraṇā paṭinivatteyya ati
translated: will be ripe in six years’ time, and he will become a Buddha, an Omniscient One, the foremost man in the world. Now, sire, would the Bodhisatta turn back for the sake of the Wheel-Jewel?”

original: “Na hi, bhante”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhantā iti
translated: “No, revered sir.”

original: “Api ca, mahārāja, mahāpathavī parivatteyya sakānanā sapabbatā, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ.🔽Āroheyyapi ce, mahārāja, gaṅgāya udakaṁ paṭisotaṁ, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ;
analyzed: api ca mahā rāja mahā pathavī parivatteyya sa kānanā sa pabbatā na tu eva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya a patvā sammāsambodhi  āroheyya api ce mahā rāja gaṅgāya udakam na tu eva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya a patvā sammāsambodhi
translated: “But, sire, the great earth might turn upside down with its mountains and forests, yet the Bodhisatta would not turn back without having reached the supreme enlightenment.🔽And, sire, the waters of the Ganges might flow upstream, yet the Bodhisatta would not turn back without having reached the supreme enlightenment.

original: visusseyyapi ce, mahārāja, mahāsamuddo aparimitajaladharo gopade udakaṁ viya, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ;🔽phaleyyapi ce, mahārāja, sinerupabbatarājā satadhā vā sahassadhā vā, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ;
analyzed: visusseyya api ce mahā rāja mahā samuddaḥ aparimita jaladharaḥ gopade udakam viya na tu eva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya a patvā sammāsambodhi  phaleyya api ce mahā rāja sineru pabbata rājā satadhā vā sahassadhā vā na tu eva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya a patvā sammāsambodhi
translated: And, sire, the great ocean might dry up with its immeasurable waters like the water in the bed of the Ganges, yet the Bodhisatta would not turn back without having reached the supreme enlightenment.🔽And, sire, the Sineru, king of mountains, might break up into a hundred or a thousand pieces, yet the Bodhisatta would not turn back without having reached the supreme enlightenment.

original: pateyyumpi ce, mahārāja, candimasūriyā satārakā leḍḍu viya chamāyaṁ, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ;

translated: And, sire, the moon and sun with their stars might fall down on the earth like a stone, yet the Bodhisatta would not turn back without having reached the supreme enlightenment.

original: saṁvatteyyapi ce, mahārāja, ākāso kilañjamiva, na tveva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya apatvā sammāsambodhiṁ.
analyzed: ce mahā rāja ākāsaḥ kilañjam iva na tu eva bodhisatto paṭinivatteyya a patvā sammāsambodhi
translated: Even if the sky, sire, were to be covered with a net, the Bodhisatta would not turn back without reaching full enlightenment.

original: Kiṁ kāraṇā?
analyzed: kim kāraṇā
translated: Why is it so?

original: Padālitattā sabbabandhanānan”ti.

translated: Because all bonds have been broken.”

original: “Bhante nāgasena, kati loke bandhanānī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena kati loke bandhanāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, how many bonds are there in the world?”

original: “Dasa kho panimāni, mahārāja, loke bandhanāni, yehi bandhanehi baddhā sattā na nikkhamanti, nikkhamitvāpi paṭinivattanti.
analyzed: dasa kho panimāni mahā rāja loke bandhanāni yehi bandhanehi baddhāḥ sattāḥ na nikkhamanti nikkhamitvā api paṭinivattanti
translated: “There are ten bonds in the world, sire, by which beings are bound and do not go forth, and having gone forth turn back again.

original: Katamāni dasa?
analyzed: katamāni dasa
translated: What are the ten?

original: Mātā, mahārāja, loke bandhanaṁ, pitā, mahārāja, loke bandhanaṁ, bhariyā, mahārāja,🔽loke bandhanaṁ, puttā, mahārāja, loke bandhanaṁ, ñātī, mahārāja, loke bandhanaṁ,

translated: Mother, sire, is a bond in the world, father is a bond in the world, wife is a bond in the world,🔽children are a bond in the world, kinsmen are a bond in the world,

analyzed: mitta mahā rāja loke bandhana dhana mahā rāja loke bandhana lābha sakkāro

translated: sovereignty is a bond in the world, the five strands of sense pleasure are a bond in the world.

original: loke bandhanaṁ, imāni kho, mahārāja, dasa loke bandhanāni, yehi bandhanehi baddhā
analyzed: loke bandhane imāni kho mahā rāja dasa loke bandhanāni yehi bandhanehi baddhā
translated: These, sire, are the ten fetters in the world. Bound by these fetters

analyzed: sattāḥ na nikkhamanti nikkhamitvā api paṭinivattanti tāni dasa bandhanāni bodhisattassa
translated: beings do not go forth. Even if they go forth they turn back. But these ten fetters

original: chinnāni padālitāni, tasmā, mahārāja, bodhisatto na paṭinivattatī”ti.🔽“Bhante nāgasena, yadi bodhisatto uppanne araticitte devatāya vacanena aparipakke
analyzed: chinnāni padālitāni tasmai mahā rāja bodhisattaḥ na paṭinivattati iti  bhante nāgasena yadi bodhisattaḥ uppanne arati citte devatāya vacanena a paripakke
translated: were cut and split by the Bodhisatta. Therefore, sire, the Bodhisatta did not turn back.”

original: ñāṇe aparipakkāya bodhiyā nekkhammamabhinikkhanto, kiṁ tassa dukkarakārikāya katāya,
analyzed: ñāṇe a paripakkāya bodhiyā nekkhammam abhinikkhanto kim tassa dukkara kārikāya katāya
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, if the Bodhisatta went forth from home into homelessness out of desire for renunciation, when the knowledge was not yet ripe and the enlightenment was not yet ripe, in accordance with the words of the deity who had arisen in his mind, what was the use of his undertaking austerities?

original: nanu nāma sabbabhakkhena bhavitabbaṁ ñāṇaparipākaṁ āgamayamānenā”ti?
analyzed: nanu nāma sabba bhakkhena bhavitabbam ñāṇa paripākam āgamayamānena ati
translated: Should he not have been an all-devourer, waiting for the ripening of his knowledge?”

original: “Dasa kho panime, mahārāja, puggalā lokasmiṁ oññātā avaññātā hīḷitā khīḷitā garahitā paribhūtā acittīkatā.
